item.title: All abortion bans — whether in Alabama or Colorado — are...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

All abortion bans — whether in Alabama or Colorado — are political attacks. They are not about health or medicine. They are about controlling women and taking away decision-making power. This is evidenced by the fact that Proposition 115 is being pushed by many of the same politicians and groups who have tried — and failed — to ban abortion altogether in Colorado every year for the last decade.

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was one of American Civil Liberties Union’s (ACLU) most illustrious alumni. She founded the ACLU’s Women’s Rights Project and in the weekend following her passing, the

coloradopolitics.com

All abortion bans are about controlling women

Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg was one of American Civil Liberties Union’s (ACLU) most illustrious alumni. item.title: ¡SÍ, SE PUEDE! Organized in 1962 by Dolores Huerta, Cesar...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

¡SÍ, SE PUEDE!

Organized in 1962 by Dolores Huerta, Cesar Chavez, and Gilbert Padilla, the United Farm Workers union fights exploitative practices toward farmworkers in the US. Its work continues today.

item.title: ***Follows in English *** Segun la Washington Post - La...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

***Follows in English ***
Segun la Washington Post - La administración dice que van a hacer redadas en ciudades como Denver donde hemos ganado protecciones tras años de organizar, que van a hacer mas detenciones antes de la elección. Este listo. Conozca sus derechos. Pon el número de respuesta rápida en su teléfono 1-844-864-8341 y llamamos si veas a ICE en su comunidad. Sigue al Colorado Rapid Response Network y en los comentarios por mas informacion.
***********************...**
According to the Washington Post - The administration says they are going to do immigration raid in cities like Denver, where we have won protections after years of organizing. They say they are going to make more ICE arrest before the election. Be ready. Know your rights. Put the rapid response number in your phone 1-844-864-8341 and call us if you see ICE in your community.
#RespuestaRapida Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC AFSC & Coloradans For Immigrant Rights Padres & Jóvenes Unidos Mi Familia Vota Colorado People's Alliance SEIU Local 105

See MoreColorado Rapid Response Network - Immigration

item.title: “South Fork is my hometown and we have established a strong...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

“South Fork is my hometown and we have established a strong connection with our community. When this happened, we felt targeted and that our livelihoods were at stake. We just want the town to recognize that what they did is wrong and that this should never happen again," Sol Mountain Farm owner Wes O’Rourke.

Solicitation of charitable donations is constitutionally protected. No one should ever feel targeted for exercising their right to free speech. For more: https://bit.ly/2GosRNm
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Colorado continues to lead the country in integrity and...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado continues to lead the country in integrity and accessibility. Coloradans can now correct ballot mistakes from their phones to ensure their voices are heard. Count every vote, every vote counts!

A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.

denverpost.com

Colorado voters will be able to fix their ballot problems via text, Secretary of State says

A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.A new program expected to launch statewide, TXT2cure, will make it easier for voters — especially younger ones — to cure, or fix, problematic ballots.

item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

"The only actionable justice we can give Breonna Taylor and others who are victims of police violence is to imagine a vision of community safety without policing."

ACLU of Colorado Racial Justice Campaign Coordinator, Jessica Howard on why we must reimagine safety. Read more at https://aclu-co.org/when-reform-is-not-enough-why-we-must-…/

item.title: Cipriano Chavez-Alvarez should be alive today. Kamyar Samimi...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Cipriano Chavez-Alvarez should be alive today. Kamyar Samimi should be alive today. ICE is responsible for their deaths and the deaths of many more people who languished in their custody. ICE must be held accountable. ICE must be defunded.

“While the medical examiner ruled the cause of death ‘undetermined,’ the complete lack of medical leadership, supervision and care that this detainee was exposed to is simply astonishing," the report states.

buzzfeednews.com

A Congressional Oversight Committee Found That ICE Detainees Died After Receiving Poor Medical Care

“While the medical examiner ruled the cause of death ‘undetermined,’ the complete lack of medical leadership, supervision and care that this detainee was exposed to is simply astonishing," the report states.“While the medical examiner ruled the cause of death ‘undetermined,’ the complete lack of medical leadership, supervision and care that this detainee was exposed to is simply astonishing," the report states.

item.title: This year's Bill of Rights event will be one to remember!...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

This year's Bill of Rights event will be one to remember! Join us as we celebrate community leaders, civil rights and civil liberties successes, and educate our community of donors, activists, and partners. Registration is free. Sign up today!

item.title: The main goal of Amendment 76 is voter suppression, specifically...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

The main goal of Amendment 76 is voter suppression, specifically when it comes to citizen-immigrant & youth voters. Colorado has one of the most secure & accessible election systems in the country. We don't need Florida in Colorado to tell us how to run elections. But we do need everyone to get the word out, that this anti-immigrant, anti-voter agenda has NO place in our state and to vote NO on 76.

A seemingly innocent ballot measure could strip young voters of their newfound rights and discourage immigrants from voting, say opponents.

coloradotimesrecorder.com

"Every" vs. "Only": Activists Point to Veiled Repercussions of CO Amendment 76

A seemingly innocent ballot measure could strip young voters of their newfound rights and discourage immigrants from voting, say opponents.A seemingly innocent ballot measure could strip young voters of their newfound rights and discourage immigrants from voting, say opponents.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado
